graphs

Class InputGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphs.InputGenerator

  • public class InputGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates an adjacency list representing a graph based on the number of vertices and the range of weights to be assigned to the edges.
    Author:
    Prakash Chandrasekaran, Gautham Narayanasamy, Vijayaraghavan Subbaiah

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputGenerator

        public InputGenerator(int numVertices,
              double minEdgeWeight,
              double maxEdgeWeight,
              java.lang.String outputFilePath)
        Instantiates a new input generator.
        Parameters:
        numVertices - the number of vertices in the graph
        minEdgeWeight - the minimum edge weight
        maxEdgeWeight - the maximum edge weight
        outputFilePath - the output file path

    • Method Detail

      • generateInput

        public void generateInput()
                   throws PropertyNotFoundException
        Generate the input to be processed by graph generator. The resulting input file will be in the following format: (line 1) (from line 2 onwards) Example : 1-2:10,3:15,4:12
        Throws:
        PropertyNotFoundException
